H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3927.def: = man; ► an unknown king, whose sayings are included in the book of Proverbs

H4853.def: literally: lifting up (one's) self; hence: = action by which humans turn to (other) humans with the confidence that they will find joy and comfort there

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H3256.def: = action by which humans or deities respond to negative behavior of (other) humans by administering some sort of punishment, which may range from a verbal rebuke to physical correction, ► often done with corrective intent, but sometimes also as retribution

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H1248.def: aramaism: = direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H5088.def: = action by which humans make a solemn promise to a deity, ► which signals a commitment to perform a certain act or behave in a specific way, usually in return for a blessing from the deity

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H4229.def: = causative action by which humans clean or dry an object or body part by rubbing it with a cloth or with their hands; sometimes extended to refer to God; ≈ sometimes associated with destruction

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3927.def: = man; ► an unknown king, whose sayings are included in the book of Proverbs

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H7336.def: used in poetry only; = ruler of a nation or people

H176.def: = particle linking two entities by which X and Y are alternative options that exclude each other

H7941.def: = alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of dates through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness{N:001}

H2710.def: = action by which humans reproduce the form or shape of an object on another object; ◄ by carving, drawing, writing, etc.; ► for the purpose of decoration, communication, sometimes as preparation for a new construction

H6040.def: literally: to be bowed down; hence: = state in which humans are suffering hardship and trouble and unable to help themselves

H7941.def: = alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of dates through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness{N:001}

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H4751.def: = a small quantity of a liquid

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H7389.def: = state in which humans lack sufficient means to live at a standard that is considered normal; ≈ sometimes associated with laziness or foolishness, but ultimately determined by God

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H483.def: = state in which humans or animals are unable to speak ◄ because of a physical limitation or because of emotions

H2475.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = people who have been left alone (such as orphans) and have no one to care for them

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H6664.def: = state in which a weight or measure is correct or accurate, in accordance with a standard

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H4672.def: = process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

H4377.def: = goods and products that are intended for trade and commerce

H6443.def: = a precious stone consisting of corundum in colour varieties varying from deep crimson or purple to pale rose; ≈ regarded as beautiful and valuable

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H1167.def: = person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband

H2637.def: = state in which humans or objects are found less in quantity or entirely absent in a location where they are supposed to be present

H1580.def: = causative process by which a mother causes her baby to become accustomed to food other than its mother's milk

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H1875.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H6785.def: = soft wavy undercoat of hairy animals such as sheep, ► used to weave a fabric from which clothing was made; ≈ associated with whiteness, purity, and softness

H6593.def: = product of a plant of about a meter tall; its leaves are narrow and the flowers are bright blue with five petals; ► the seed capsule contains oil; after the plants have ripened they are uprooted and the stalks are left to dry for a while; they are then soaked, dried, and beaten to separate the fibers, which are then combed and woven into linen cloth

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H2656.def: = state in which humans and deities are emotionally attached to (other) humans

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

glosses: to move about freely > to trade
H5503.def: = action of moving from place to place ► to carry out activities of commerce

H591.def: = boat ◄ of a relatively large size ► that is able to sail the sea or ocean

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H4801.def: = state in which humans, deities, objects, or events are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H2964.def: literally: what is torn apart; hence: = slain victim of a carnivorous animal; ≈ associated with a violent death, bloodshed, and frequently used as a metaphor for victims of warfare

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H2706.def: = specific actions required by somebody in authority

H5291.def: = a young female, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people

H2161.def: = action by which deities or humans put together a plan or strategy to act on; often in a bad sense

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H6529.def: = produce from crop-bearing trees and plants

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H5193.def: = action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors

H3754.def: = field where {L:grapes<SDBH:עֲנָב>} are cultivated, growing on {L:vines<SDBH:גֶּפֶן>}; typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a {L:watchtower<SDBH:מִגְדָּל>} and a {L:wine press<SDBH:יֶקֶב>}

H2296.def: = state in which someone wears clothes or armor

H4975.def: = the two sides of the body of humans and certain animals between the rib cage and the hips, ► which is the place where people normally tie a girdle, breeches, loincloth, or sackcloth; ≈ a symbol of strength

H5797.def: = state in which an object is able to withstand force

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H553.def: = state in which humans have political and/or military strength

H2938.def: = process by which the flavor of food is perceived, when eating

H3518.def: = process by which a fire comes to an end, either in a natural way or by force

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3601.def: = short, oblong wooden stick with a weight on the top (= {L:פֶּלֶךְ<SDBH:פֶּלֶךְ>} "whorl"); ► used for spinning fibers into a thread

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3847.def: = state in which humans wear certain clothes, often for a specific purpose

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H2205.def: = state in which a human being is nearing the end of a long life

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H4376.def: = causative action by which humans hand over objects or privileges in their possession in exchange for goods or money

H5797.def: = state in which an object is able to withstand force

H3830.def: = generic designation for any article of clothing

H7832.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H314.def: = pertaining to being located behind other objects in a row

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H8451.def: = causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H6822.def: = action by which humans or deities watch attentitvely to monitor people and places

H1979.def: = action by which humans move forward, usually towards a specific destination

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H1167.def: = person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H1892.def: = a slight movement of air; ≈ associated with something without substance, that quickly passes away
